userPrompt:
You are writing a ```{{novelStyle}}``` book for ```{{averageAge}}```. IMPORTANT: Write the entire chapter in ```{{language}}```. Compose chapter ```{{chapterNumber}}```, titled "```{{chapterTitle}}```." This chapter should include: ``` {{chapterSynopses}} ``` Write in ```{{language}}```, in detailed multiple paragraphs, the full plot of the chapter. Do not repeat any information already included in previous chapters. The story should be based on the following user description. Extract only the details necessary for this chapter's context. ``` {{description}} ``` Write in the ```{{novelStyle}}``` style, ensuring the narrative voice and content match this genre. The story should feel authentic to the ```{{novelStyle}}``` genre while remaining engaging and accessible. - If not already described in previous chapters, describe each character, their traits, the settings, and every moment of the story thoroughly - Write in a way that makes the reading engaging and captivating for ```{{averageAge}}```. Consider their: - Reading comprehension level - Emotional maturity - Interests and concerns typical for this age group - Attention span, paragraph and chapter length preferences - The synopsis includes writing tips and instructions, delimited by {{}}. Follow them but DO NOT return any writing instruction or tip. - Use vivid descriptions and gentle suspense appropriate for the target audience - Maintain consistency with the ```{{novelStyle}}``` genre conventions - Ensure the language complexity matches ```{{averageAge}}``` reading level - For babies and toddlers (0-2 years): Write MAXIMUM 2 paragraphs. Keep text extremely short and simple. - For preschoolers (3-6 years): Write MAXIMUM 4 paragraphs. Keep text concise and engaging. - For all other age groups: Write in detailed multiple paragraphs as appropriate for the age group. - Use basic HTML formatting to make content more engaging for children: - Use bold text for emphasis on important words and exciting moments - Use italic text for character names, thoughts, sounds, whispers, or special emphasis - Use larger font size for dramatic moments, exclamations, or key story elements - Apply HTML formatting strategically to enhance the reading experience and maintain child engagement - Do not overuse formatting - use it purposefully to highlight important story elements - Each paragraph of the chapter MUST be wrapped in

HTML tags ``` {{hookInstruction}} ``` Return only the chapter full content, without the chapter title. Structure your response as follows: 1. Each paragraph must be wrapped in

tags 2. Apply HTML formatting (bold, italic, larger text) as specified above 3. Ensure proper HTML structure throughout 4. Do not include the chapter title in your response
